Authors:
Mario Zapata, María Antonieta Palma, Maria Jose aninat,
Eduardo Piontelli
Title:
Polyphasic studies of three new species of Diaporthe from
native forest in Chile
Journal:
International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary
Microbiology
Keywords:
Taxonomy, DNA analyses, araucanorum, foikelawen,
patagonica
Abstract:
During a survey of fungi on native forest in Chile,
several isolates of Diaporthe were collected from different hosts. The
isolates were characterized based on DNA comparisons, morphology,
culture characteristics and host affiliation, in accordance with
previous descriptions. Phylogenetic analysis of ITS region, combined
with BT and TEF1-α genes, showed that the isolates formed three distinct
groups representing three new taxa. The three new species of Diaporthe,
D. araucanorum on Araucaria araucana, D. foikelawen on Drimys winteri
and D. patagonica on Aristotelia chilensis are described and illustrated
in the present study.
